ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned different drawing techniques, how to engage in artistic critique, and how to understand art as a nuanced concept.

I learned basic technical skills (line, gesture, perspective value). I also learned how to execute a drawing from beginning to end, starting with the conceptualization of the project and ending with the actualization of the drawing. I gained more faith in myself as an artist.
Improved technical ability in drawing and discussion of art through critiques
This class led me to become a better drawer and develop skills that helped me display on paper what I imagine.

Through a few guided exercises and lots of personal exploration, we learned basic drawing techniques. These include, perspective, value, line and everything else we would need to start our very own projects.
Basic drawing skills like line, value, composition, and crosshatching
This semester I learned basic drawing techniques using the medium charcoal.
drawing a human body, shading, shadow, perspective, paper prepping

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Stregths: Kern was a wonderfil instructor. He was very open and allowed us to take our art in whatever direction we wanted. He created an open and welcoming environment for studentssomething very important for an introductory art class.

Weakness: I think we spent too much in-class time just working on our midterm and final projects. The last 6 classes (12 hours of class time) were devoted to working on our final project. While this helped me have no homework for the class during a busy time, I took drawing for a reason. I would've much rather spent that time learning more drawing techniques and practicing in different drawing activities.

The strengths of this course were absolutely Kern and Grant. They were always extremely supportive in class, no matter what a student's ability may be, and gave feedback that was actually constructive. Everyone, for the most part, felt very engaged with the material and it was clear that people cared about the class.

Strengths: covered very foundational drawing techniques through exercises instead of lectures, interesting project prompts
Weaknesses: long meeting times
Strengths only for this class- very low stress in this class thanks to Kern and Grant, along with other classmates. was easy to have productful drawing sessions and conversation.

I certainly enjoyed the emphasis on individual projects in this course over introductory exercises. It was a great way to make the very most of our professors knowledge by asking for the tips and guidance that we individually desired. However, I could see this being frustrating to those who dont know exactly what questions to ask or how to ask them.
It was a great course! I really thought the units were all very instructive and that the artist presentation introduced me to great artists
This class allows you to explore basic drawing techniques which all culminate into a final project of your choosing.
the course was amazing. I learnt so much without even realising. No weaknesses.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! Even if you don't consider yourself a "great" artist, this class will help you grow no matter what. I also felt that drawing and the act of creating art was extremely therapeutic, and it was really great to have structured time to create art during the semester. I would especially recommend this class if Kern is teaching ithe is a gem of an instructor and perhaps one of the best professors I have learned from at this university.
Yes, I took this class as a requirement for the art major but would recommend it for anyone; I had the chance to improve my drawing techniques and talk about art with classmates.
Yes, if you like to draw this a perfect entry level course.

I would recommend this course to anyone and everyone. Im not sure of the directions other professors take this course, but my time in this studio definitely allowed me to improve my artistic ability with great support from the professors.
I would recommend this course to any student. Even though I was taking it as a requirement for the art major, it was a very therapeutic change of pace from my other classes.
Yes, if they have any interest in art whatsoever. No prior experience needed.
Yes, this class is perfect even if you dont have any experience drawing with charcoal.

yes. this is the only course where I actually learnt something this semester. it is not just an art course, but a life course that teacher you not to give up, but to try, to experiment, and to thrust the proccess.
